39290436.review:
Dungeon is considered to be the best Sakura game and for good reasons, it's really an all-around solid title, with surprisingly good dungeon crawling segments, awesome soundtrack and even a somewhat decent story, that gives it much more substance than just the usual tons of fanservice Winged Cloud relies on.

Make no mistake, the shittons of fanservice are still there and maybe in amount and variety much greater than in any other game in the series. But while I've expected finding only that when approaching this game, there were many positive surprises awaiting me. The first one was probably the protagonist, Yomi, who as a centuries-old fox spirit is really an unusual heroine to be in the centre of this kind of story. She's also simply a compelling character, probably the highlight of the whole game, showing really interesting traits and simply providing a rare perspective to observe this kind of fantasy adventure from. While the game's writing in general wasn't brilliant, I really liked most things connected to her and her interactions with Ceri, the human knight that (unwillingly) accompanies her on the quest to reclaim the titular dungeon.

The RPG mechanics were simple, but quite elegant, with just enough customization and complexity to make them enjoyable, while exploring the dungeon itself was well-paced (no pointless grind and backtracking, at least on normal difficulty) and fun. The game respects your time, what's not necessarily true even with many "serious" JRPGs and RPGs nowadays and it's clear that its main mechanics and level layout were pretty well-though out. It's really more than I've expected from this developer and something I can deeply appreciate as a person with very limited free time.

While everything you do in the game is more or less an excuse to throw cartoon nudity (and mild yuri romance) at you, I have to say that in the end it was all pretty enjoyable and consistent in quality. The attempts at being "sexy" didn't really grab me most of the time, but I know many people are very much into the kind of sexual content Sakura games offer and I was (nearly) impressed by the execution and variety of it here. And underneath that somewhat obnoxious mass of anime boobs and girls-kissing CGs, there's a really decent game hidden.

[b]If you really want to see what the games in Sakura series are all about, buy this one - and if you're already a fan of the franchise, Dungeon should be extremely enjoyable for you. Just be wary, Winged Cloud is alleged to be guilty of some very nasty business practises and produces tons of embarrassingly bad VNs that gives the whole genre a bad name - be sure you're ok with supporting a company like that before you buy Sakura Dungeon, even if the game itself in definitely worth playing.[/b]

39146683.review:
[h1] Sakura Dungeon [/h1]

In Sakura Dungeon you play as Yomi who happens to be a dungeon Lord, she's been hidden away for 100's of years and has lost her dungeon . Your goal is to reclaim your dungeon but you can't do it alone, once you've "captured" some party members you can, explore dungeons, collect loot, do side quests, and fight in random encounters.

As you've probably guessed it, this is going to be a dungeon crawler so you best be ready for repetitive gameplay and annoying encounters but once you get past all that the gameplay isn't that bad and there's hours of fun to play. It's very fan-serviced game so if you're into cute anime girls with lawd pictures then wait for a sale and buy this game!

For those who haven't played the previous Sakura games.... don't worry! Winged Cloud haven't linked ANY of them together for this game, in fact, this one is completely different to the rest. This one has a lot of interaction, which is always something I look for in these type of games.

It's one of my favorite Sakura games! (To date) a 9.5/10 should fit the bill nicely.

39122232.review:
양산형 사쿠라 게임들 가운데 제대로 '게임'의 형태를 갖추었다. 던전 크롤러 RPG게임으로, 스샷에서 볼 수 있듯 게임 분위기는 전반적으로 밝고 코믹하다. 특별할 것 없는 스토리지만 전개가 자연스럽고, 종반에 가서 괜히 분위기 잡고 무거워지지 않아서 좋다. 동료나 의상 수집하는 재미도 있다. (뭐 본질적으로는 야겜이니까 CG 모으기는 당연히 있다.)

게임적인 면을 보면, 비교적 캐주얼한 던전 크롤러 게임으로, 별 스트레스 없이 진행 가능하다. 보통 난이도 기준으로 특별히 레벨노가다 하지 않아도 될 난이도다. 맵을 다 밝히면서 진행하는 정도의 속도로 플레이하면, 던전 진행에 따른 난이도 상승과 플레이어 레벨업이 비슷하게 이루어진다. (몇몇 이벤트 보스들은 다음 층에서 레벨을 좀 높이고 되돌아올 필요는 있다.) 거의 모든 적을 동료로 삼을 수 있으며 동료로 삼은 이후 꿔다놓은 보릿자루가 되는 게 아니라 전투에 데려가면 이벤트 장면에서 한마디씩 하다보니 존재감도 있다. 스토리를 다 끝내고도 던전을 계속 돌면서  수집을 완료할 수 있는 것도 좋은 점이다.

다만 던전의 넓이에 비해 동료가 너무 많아서 다양하게 진득하게 키워보기가 힘들고 결국은 주연급 캐릭터 위주로 편성하게 되다보니 대부분의 동료들이 벤치 신세가 되는 점은 아쉽다. 적 포획은 CG 이벤트 정도로 끝내고 동료 수를 크게 줄였으면 어땠을까 싶다. 그 외에 각종 스킬 두루마리들이 장착하기 전까지는 성능을 알 수 없다는 것도 문제점이다.

게임 볼륨이 좀 작은 게 아쉬운데 스토리 추가 DLC가 나와줬으면 하는 바람이다. 끝으로 한패를 만들어주신 김개만두님께 감사를 표한다.

38694420.review:
Certains disent qu'il se joue à une main.
Pourquoi pas, mais certainement pas avec les pieds.


S a k u r a  D u n g e o n 
____________________


"SD" est un mix agréable entre jeu sexy et combats au tour-par-tour en donjon, dans la lignée d'un "Might & Magic" par exemple.
Bien sûr, tout est light, mais c'est plutôt une qualité ici.

Ce qui émane de ce titre est une certaine finesse, dans le graphisme, la direction artistique, l'écriture, la mécanique de gameplay, et les options.
On pouvait craindre quelque chose de grossier, au sens, trop appuyé, quasi-ridicule, au niveau des artworks et scènes holé-holé. Nenni : c'est mignon, et parfois, ça fait du bien.
Pour ce qui relève du jeu en tant que tel, si on le paramètre en "hard", ou au plus difficile même, ça donne des suées.
Il ne s'agit pas, comme "Sakura Clicker", ou un autre "Sakura novel", de cliquer en attendant que ça se passe.
Ici, on joue.

Action : 
Vous incarnez donc la maîtresse du donjon, déchue, mais pas déçue : pragmatique et enthousiaste, elle va simplement rallier à sa cause toute une volière de poulettes plus jolies les unes que les autres, qui chacune auront leurs capacités de combat, et que vous allez capturer pour enrichir l'écurie.
La partie se déroule entre la ville, où on optimise ses troupes, et le donjon, où on avance le long d'une exploration méritante.
Ce n'est pas "Grimrock" non plus, soyons franc, vous n'irez pas regarder des tuto YouTube ou lire des guides Steam.
Mais les règles sont ainsi faites, que si vous rêvassez, vous allez prendre cher.

Tout d'abord, chacune de vos combattantes aura des compétences plus ou moins idéales face à telle ou telle ennemie.
Ensuite, leur équipement va s'abîmer, et ce, pas seulement pour le plaisir des yeux : certes elles seront quasi nues, ce qui peut agrémenter votre run, mais également vous décconcentrer, et surtout, elles encaisseront très mal les coups.
D'un autre côté, vous pouvez prendre du niveau, vous entraîner à associer les meilleures nanas, avec les skills les plus payants; mais aussi gérer votre argent et stock de potions, parchemins, ou artefacts.
La présence de boss, et de combats tactiques plus ardus, signalés sur la map, vous amèneront à sauvegarder avant une rencontre musclée. Car le game-over est tout à fait d'actualité.
D'ailleurs le donjon va devenir plus retors à mesure que l'on s'y enfonce gaiement. Pièges, labyrinthes et surprises sont au programme, avec les events (scènes scénarisées à choix potentiels). 

Un des aspects agréables de ce Sakura, vient du fait qu'on y trouve que des femmes.
Il n'y a aucune présence masculine, et, messieurs, si votre écurie grandit, vous ne monterez pas dessus pour autant.
Ici c'est pas "Mirror" ou "Material Girl".

Incarner la maîtresse du donjon déchue et recruter sa bande se déroulera dans une atmosphère girly et soignée, qui, même si elle saura vous montrer quelques images de nudité (*), ne tombera pas dans le hentaï vulgos.
C'est un trip beaucoup plus soft, et, mélangé à la touche Pokemon / Dungeon crawler, fait son petit effet au joueur blasé de tout... et même aux joueuses..!

(*) le patch est gratuit et trouvable aisément.

Не знаю, будет ли полезным кому мнение незнакомца или нет... но всё же...
Данная игра из себя представляет не только эротическую галерею, как может показаться тем кто решил её купить хоть это и неотъемлемая часть её, но начну по порядку.
Ознакомился я с ней на стороннем ресурсе и сразу показалась чем-то необычным, чем-то во что действительно стоит поиграть (она сильно повлияла на мой профиль в стиме). От данного автора были представленны до момента её выхода только визуальные новеллы и хоть они считаються одними из лучших, всё же для меня этот жанр скоре напоминает тонкую книгу с большими картинками, разве что дополнительно с выбором различных вариантов, хотя такие варианты книг тоже существуют мол перелестни на эту страницу если твой герой выбрал так, на другую если этак...Но это совершенно другая песня...
Игра в жанре РПГ в которой присуствует львиная доля исследования локаций с целью набивания опыта и лута, всё же с моей точки зрения рпг с натяжкой так как фактически статы растут только у одного персонажа, но разницу в уровне с мобами всё же прийдёться сокращать, так как, иначе, вы по ним не попадёте и высокий шанс что огребёте по полной...
Игра напичкана юмором, моралью того вымышленого мира, и постоянным остережением вас, со стороны главного действующего лица, от поспешных действий обусловленным тем что ,если вы переоцените свои силы, игра закончиться...
Эротиеский патч советую установить сразу, дело даже не в том что так велит пипка XD, просто без него сюжет игры солидно урезаеться...ну а если спалит мамка, ну что уж тут на её месте я бы радовался что сын гетеро и не разглядывает мужиков.
Сама игра в ванильном варианте кажеться слегка сыроватой, ну да вроде неплохая боевая система, ну да вроде неплохие арты, к тексту нет претензий там всё прекрасно... Но есть один мастер своего дела  который делает модики на данную игру и визуально приукрашивает создавая гифки и озвучку для игры единственный минус в том что моды на корейском ( сам ставил пока только озвучку ибо она не конликтует с английской версией), и можно сказать что благодаря ему эта игра дорабатываеться и становиться приличным проэктом... Ну в общем да, притного времяпровождения вам.

38246807.review:
First, a one-line review of the game:
Wizardry-lite with a dash of Pokemon, and a healthy helping of smut.

Now, a more in-depth review:
Dungeon crawling: Good enough for what it is. Nothing crazy involved, but enough to entertain.

Enemy variety: You get 2-3 new monsters per floor, interspersed with monsters from the prior floor. All but the ones in the final dungeon segment can be captured. Due to how leveling works in the game, and the stat limits from raw leveling on the monster girls, you're incentivized to cycle into new monsters as you progress.

18+ content: If you remove the face from all of the girls in this game, 97% of them would look identical. Same naked body, same bust size, same shape to nether regions, all perfectly clean. Smallest cup size is a high C, most are D, with one or two characters going into DD or beyond territory. No love is given for the A-to-B cup girls in this art.

So going off of my play of the game alone, I'd say if you have no problems supporting a shady company (EA fanpeeps, I'm looking at you right now), toss a few bucks at the game. But, if you have ANY moral standards, watch the below-linked video (Thanks, Transflection!) and understand why I wish I could un-buy the bundle that contained this game, or at least change my fund allocation to 100% not go to the developer.

This is a weird one, really: an all female, scantily clad band of companions going on an epic quest that, for the most part, involves grinding your way through level and level of dungeon, beating up a bunch of random monsters, breaking vases and barrels, and sometimes struggling against an extra-tough boss like it's a sexy modern take on old school [i]Wizardry[/i] or [i]Might & Magic[/i] or something.

Somewhat unexpectedly, like those serious RPG gems from days of yore, [i]Sakura Dungeon[/i] actually has a a pretty good story that makes the betimes tedious dungeon-delving worthwhile for those who're not here just for the eye candy.

Though I must say, the eye candy sure makes sticking with it during the grindier parts easier than it ever was in any [i]Wizardry[/i]...

37425658.review:
他のレビューの人もおっしゃっていますが、一つのダンジョンゲーとして見ると平均的な出来です。
しかし、かわいいモン娘を主体にしたゲームと割り切ればかなり良質な部類に入ると思います。

まず、モンスターの女の子一人一人にちゃんと設定があるのが良いです。
例えば、このゲームで仲間になるモン娘達は基本、謙虚で偉大なるマスターこと、狐娘のヨミ様に説得されて仲間になりますが、皆、ダンジョンマスター（ラスボス）を裏切って味方陣営に入る理由が違います。
当然、裏切る理由だけでなく、各モンスターは性格も違うので、イベントシーンでの会話の掛け合いも仲間になった同行モンスターの個性が反映されて面白いです。
ちなみに一般モンスターの捕獲→説得の流れだけでなく、貴重アイテムを貢いだり、ラスボスに捨てられて落ち込んでる所で相談にのるなどすることで、ボス級モンスターも仲間に加えられますよ。

こんな感じで、個性豊かな女の子モンスターと冒険するのですから、必然的に愛着がわくモンスターも出てくると思います。
しかし悲しいかな、後から仲間になるモンスター程、基本能力が高くなりますので、ゲームを有利に進めるには、後から仲間に加わるモンスターに次々乗り換えるのが効率的です。
それでも、「自分の好みのモン娘と最後まで冒険したい！」と思う方もいるでしょう、そんな時の救済処置も「シード」と言うパラメイター増強アイテム（でもかなり高額）があるので大丈夫です。
この辺、スタッフはギャルゲプレイヤーの心理をよく理解してるな～と感じるので好感が持てます。

あと平均的と言ったゲーム部分も、逆に考えればストレスフリーです。
ダンジョンの障害も、通れる壁やワープ、回転床等、ある意味この手のお約束ばかりなので、ギャルゲ要素の邪魔になっていません。
サクサク進められると思いますよ。

36694479.review:
Итак, игра довольно занятная. Вариация на тему первых частей Final Fantasy с элементами классической визуальной новеллы в стиле аниме. Ходишь по локациям, в разных местах нападают монстры и начинается пошаговый бой с выбором заклинаний и действий. В процессе "плутания" по подземелью и происходит повествование сюжета в диалогах героев. 
Сюжет довольно тривиальный, кто-то "плохой" подло забрал "трон" у бывшего "хорошего короля" (как это часто бывает, за него и играешь) и он собирает армию, чтобы восстановить справедливость. Но игра затягивает, до самого конца не показывается кто же все-таки этот подлец, который забрал царство (подземелье) у доброй лисы. Также стоит отметить что на уровнях довольно много секретов, что тоже вносит свою лепту в "затягивание" в игру (по-крайней мере таких как я, кто стремится понравившиеся игры проходить на 100%).
По графике что тут сказать? Нарисованы персонажи добротно, красиво я бы даже сказал. Порой было даже интересно как того или иного врага разработчики смогли нарисовать. Ну и конечно сиськи, куда же без них? 
Саундтрек, обычный для визуальной новеллы, ничего выдающегося не услышал.
В общем-то и все. Довольно неплохая игра. Правда с темой секса, на мой взгляд, перегнули. Износ брони обрисован отрываниями частей одежды с последующим выкатыванием голых сисек. Практически всех персонажей "случайно" застаешь во время плотских утех. Понятно что жанр у игр такой, плюс серия Sakura, но как-то перебор. 
Ну а если вы любитель жанра Хентай/Этти и пришли за голыми анимешными "телочками", то эта игра Must Have :)
Оценка: 8 голых сисек из 10.
P.S. Подобный сюжет можно было бы обрисовать и без голых сисек и обилия секса и было бы интересно, но тогда это была бы не Sakura.

36684829.review:
Also ich war vor dem Kauf sehr skeptisch und habe eigentlich mit einem Fehlkauf gerechnet. 

Letztlich habe ich es mir geholt, weil ich einen klassischen DungeonCrawler zocken wollte und die Reviews hier doch ganz gut sind.

Ich bin so was von positiv überrascht! SD ist ein guter DungeonCrawler mit RPG Elementen. Die Spielmechanik ist wirklich solide. Die Kämpfe laufen rundenbasiert ab, ähnlich wie beispielsweise in den gaaanz alten FinalFantasys. 
Der Umfang ist für den Preis sehr groß, ich habe ca 40 Stunden von Anfang bis Ende benötigt. Die Story ist im großen und ganzen linear ohne große Twists. Die größere Stärke dabei ist aber, dass die Geschichte und die Beziehung der Charaktere untereinander sehr schön und humorvoll erzählt wird. Neben dem Dungeon gibt es (optional) kleine Sidequests sowie "lustige und schmutzige" Geschichten über die Charaktere. Selbst habe ich es mit dem kostenlosen Uncut Patch gespielt, ohne fehlen wohl teilweise Spielinhalte. 

Ehrlich, ich hatte viel Spaß am Spiel - und damit meine ich nicht, dass es dabei zusätzlich sehr schön anzusehen ist. Das Spiel wäre sogar auch ohne erotischen Inhalten gut.

36638928.review:
This 9th title of the Sakura series from Winged Cloud feature a female novice knight Ceri who inadvertently released an ancient fox spirit and former dungeon lord of the dungeon Ceri was exploring. Being no match for the fox spirit Yomi, Ceri was forced into servitude to Yomi to help Yomi regain her former position as the dungeon lord. As Ceri and Yomi explore each level of the dungeon, battle, capture and recruit the monsters along the way, they are joined by an all-female cast of heroine characters and monsters that will help to shed light on the new dungeon lord that has imprisoned Yomi for centuries and an impending campaign of war and destruction by unknown mysterious forces as well as provide comedy, humour and yuri fanservice.

The game contains both role-playing game(RPG) and visual novel as a dungeon crawler where Ceri will bring along up to 5 other followers to accompany her in a quest to defeat the monsters in each level, locate the keys and defeat the guardian(boss monster) of each level to proceed further into the next level. All monsters have unique sprites and most monsters will have a few lines of dialogue if they are accompanying Ceri during certain specific event sections relevant to the monster's domain area. The dungeon levels have sufficient variety which include a Western castle, an Eastern manor, an underground cavern, an Egyptian pyramid, an abyssal realm and a futuristic spaceship across 30 levels with false/breakable walls, pitfalls, spike traps, teleporters and spinners. There are also a number of optional side quests which will reward the player with an achievement and often a unique monster which Ceri can bring along as a follower.

Having played through the earlier titles of the Sakura series, this title has the largest number of female characters in the game with an all-female cast of 2 non-player characters(NPCs), 8 heroines, 10 unique monsters, 35 monsters, 3 non-recruitable monsters and 3 non-recruitable unique monsters and boss heroines with plenty of CGs. The background music by Zack Parrish and artwork by Badriel, Fatelinealpha, Wanaca, kauru and MMrailgun are great and make this the largest scale Sakura title compared to all previous titles of the series with a very large number of cards in a set required to craft a badge, emoticons and profile backgrounds. Among the cons, by being the first Sakura title as an RPG with Steam achievements, there are 2 potentially missable achievements from starting the game at an incorrect difficulty mode, an achievement(Breaker of Armies) that require grinding for at least 30 hours and some of the achievements may not unlock correctly unless the game is installed to a beta version.

Overall, this RPG and visual novel is highly recommended when at discount or bundle offer for fans of Winged Cloud who might be interested in collecting the titles in the Sakura series, a long dungeon crawler RPG(More than 30 hours) with fanservice, humour, romance, mystery, thriller, fantasy and science fiction themes, appropriate background music to match the different locations, battles, funny and erotic moments throughout the game, great artwork in the trading cards, badges, emoticons and profile artwork for this game and don't mind a good challenge or looking past a few achievements that might be difficult to unlock.

(No spoilers)
It's definitely a well-made game, but if you are just playing it for fun, don't play it on abyssal.
The plot is good, and lives up to the Sakura name. 
The game on abyssal is essentially save after every five steps, so you don't get completely demolished, and have either your armour broken, or your life broken.
The achievements are all fairly easy to get, but they get you with the 2500 and 5000 kill ones. I had to move forwards and backwards for over 4 hours after the game was completed in order to get 5000 kills, but it was still worth it.
It's worth the $22 CAD, BUT if you are on the edge of buying it or not, the game's like $7 CAD on (they take the name down if spelt normally) G   2   A, while I don't fully support this method of purchase, I'd rather have this game's fame spread, than have people hesitant on the full price of the game.
AND PLEASE, play the game with the H-Patch. I'm not sure why anyone would play this game without it.

36524703.review:
I am a long-time follower of the Sakura games, and I believe that Sakura Dungeon is the best game of the collection (at the time I am writing this review). 
The mix of a visual novel story and character development with a simple and well designed dungeon crawler greatly expanded the game's longevity, which had been one of the recurring issues with the Sakura games. Also, with the increased longevity came with a more smooth and enjoyable story progression.
In terms of sheer content, this has the most CGs in all Sakura games, and, once you complete the main story, you are given access to the sprites and background in a way that you can create your own scenes for you to create your own images.

If you are a fan of dungeon crawlers, or you thoroughly enjoy visual novels, I would highly recommend Sakura Dungeon.

For those that are not much experience with visual novels or dungeon crawlers, I would recommend this game when it is on sale.

36482800.review:
Very basic dungeon crawler with simple elements thats easy to pick up. Capturing dungeon monsters and using them as allies is an interesting concept rather than making your own units or getting them from a randomized recruitment place or something. Although it can be a bit frustrating with the low chance of capturing enemies as you get further into the game, requiring you to fight and successfully capture the same monster multiple times until you get it. Also unforunately another problem I have with the game is that the skill scrolls dont tell you what they do so you kind of have to just use them to get their description and then load the game to use it properly if you want. 

I played it on hard and unfortunately hard mode is pretty hard for all the wrong reasons. Never have I seen so many enemies land so many hits with a 30% chance or less so often, 9 out of 10 times they seem to always hit. And never have I seen so many of my own characters miss with a 80% chance or higher. I've lost count of how many times an attack has missed with a 99% chance to hit. It makes the game very frustrating and you've got to take it a lot slower with the whole game weighted against you but if you're into that, hard mode might be fore you. Playing on normal will probably give you a much easier and more enjoyable experience. 

[strike]And of course be sure to get the uncensored patch for all that good eye candy you paid for[/strike]

36140458.review:
总的来说，这是一个因为某种原因睡了几百年的某地下城狐仙扛把子，被勇者唤醒了之后收服勇者夺回自己的地盘的故事，在此过程中将看见的妹子的衣服统统扒了并关进监狱最后收为己用；才玩了个开头，之后会怎样展开还不清楚。
一个回合制探险游戏，游戏性方面没什么可说的，总体来说中规中矩，虽然有捕捉怪物妹子的设定，但怪物种类似乎有些少，我走了两层，总共遇见了三种不同的妹子；战斗界面也比较简单，鼠标点点点。
画风和人物立绘好评，妹子们的身材好评，就是腿有些粗。
但不得不承认，一开始之所以买这个游戏，完全是冲着不可描述去的，脑补了一出“狐狸女王用魔法和皮鞭让她的俘虏沉浸在肉♀欲的快感中不能自拔，最后从肉体到精神双重沉沦沦为女王奴隶“的故事，然而玩了3个小时之后我发现自己想多了，女主是靠嘴炮走天下的，预想中的调♀教情节并没有发生。
当女勇者要去洗澡的时候，我J儿梆硬，脑补着之后狐狸和她的仆从露出獠牙，然而人家真就是洗个澡而已；
当抓住了第一个俘虏，急吼吼地从地宫回到小镇的时候，我血脉贲张，幻想着狐狸用自己高超的技巧把兔子玩到坏，然而人家一顿嘴炮，兔子就乖乖降了。
又仔细看了下其他玩家的评测，我发现我真的是想多了。
不过总体而言，还是推荐这款游戏，画面是真的不错。

36118132.review:
This 9th title of the Sakura series from Winged Cloud feature a female novice knight Ceri who inadvertently released an ancient fox spirit and former dungeon lord of the dungeon Ceri was exploring. Being no match for the fox spirit Yomi, Ceri was forced into servitude to Yomi to help Yomi regain her former position as the dungeon lord. As Ceri and Yomi explore each level of the dungeon, battle, capture and recruit the monsters along the way, they are joined by an all-female cast of heroine characters and monsters that will help to shed light on the new dungeon lord that has imprisoned Yomi for centuries and an impending campaign of war and destruction by unknown mysterious forces as well as provide comedy, humour and yuri fanservice.

The game contains both role-playing game(RPG) and visual novel as a dungeon crawler where Ceri will bring along up to 5 other followers to accompany her in a quest to defeat the monsters in each level, locate the keys and defeat the guardian(boss monster) of each level to proceed further into the next level. All monsters have unique sprites and most monsters will have a few lines of dialogue if they are accompanying Ceri during certain specific event sections relevant to the monster's domain area. The dungeon levels have sufficient variety which include a Western castle, an Eastern manor, an underground cavern, an Egyptian pyramid, an abyssal realm and a futuristic spaceship across 30 levels with false/breakable walls, pitfalls, spike traps, teleporters and spinners. There are also a number of optional side quests which will reward the player with an achievement and often a unique monster which Ceri can bring along as a follower.

Having played through the earlier titles of the Sakura series, this title has the largest number of female characters in the game with an all-female cast of 2 non-player characters(NPCs), 8 heroines, 10 unique monsters, 35 monsters, 3 non-recruitable monsters and 3 non-recruitable unique monsters and boss heroines with plenty of CGs. The background music by Zack Parrish and artwork by Badriel, Fatelinealpha, Wanaca, kauru and MMrailgun are great and make this the largest scale Sakura title compared to all previous titles of the series with a very large number of cards in a set required to craft a badge, emoticons and profile backgrounds. Among the cons, by being the first Sakura title as an RPG with Steam achievements, there are 2 potentially missable achievements from starting the game at an incorrect difficulty mode, an achievement(Breaker of Armies) that require grinding for at least 30 hours and some of the achievements may not unlock correctly unless the game is installed to a beta version.

Overall, this RPG and visual novel is highly recommended when at discount or bundle offer for fans of Winged Cloud who might be interested in collecting the titles in the Sakura series, a long dungeon crawler RPG(More than 30 hours) with fanservice, humour, romance, mystery, thriller, fantasy and science fiction themes, appropriate background music to match the different locations, battles, funny and erotic moments throughout the game, great artwork in the trading cards, badges, emoticons and profile artwork for this game and don't mind a good challenge or looking past a few achievements that might be difficult to unlock.

36080159.review:
A unique take on the Sakura series by Winged Cloud (by which I mean not a visual novel). I really enjoyed this game, playing RPG's for me are always fun, but Dungeon's way of doing this is really cool. Players can "collect" their own teammates and use them in battle. The characters are different and unique and the different environments are very cool. A downside is that sometimes I felt that some characters repeat things more often than not (see Ceri) but apart from that I enjoyed the characters. The music is nice as well, with my personal favourites being the midboss battle music and the title screen music. The gameplay is fun while battling, however the gameplay when exploring can get repetitive at times. However, that's nitpicking as the positive of the battles outweigh the negatives of exploring.


Overall:

Pros:

+ Fun battle gameplay.
+ Story is fun to read.
+ Likable characters.
+ Environments are unique.
+ Enjoyable music.


Cons:

- Characters can repeat certain saying too often.
- Exploration can be repetitive.

Overall Score:

8/10

35980354.review:
This was a really fun dungeon crawlling romp. My favorite Sakura series game to date, and a darned good game as a whole on its own too.

Reminds me a lot of the lesser-known Lightning Warrior Raidy games, in fact I'd be almost positive the developers at Winged Cloud took inspiration from them. Except I feel it is even better than the LWR series of games for a few important reasons.

One really major one is in the LWR games, sex scenes were prone to being a bit dark or often used as punishment for wrongdoing, and sometimes were clearly sex without consent. Sakura Dungeon however does not fall into this trap.

That was one thing I really appreciated about the whole attitude of Sakura Dungeon and its characters. It was clear that Yomi, one of the main characters in the story, was very accepting of all walks of life with her defending the different kinds of monsters, not chastising other characters for their choice of behavior a lot of times, and even when there were some punishments to be had for wrongdoing, usually compromises were offered, or the actual punishments were hardly of a detrimental nature and were usually more like giving second chances with guidance.

In other words she was a refreshingly understanding, forgiving, and gentle protagonist for an RPG, and it made the game very enjoyable to play through knowing that no matter the seeming severity of the current agenda, it was all handled rather peacefully and with a healthy dose of humility, and not forcefully guns blazing with no remorse like you see in so many other games.

Even Ceri, the other main protagonist, through her character growth as the game progressed, learned the value of Yomi's wise and mostly gentle ways, and also to just lighten up a little bit and let her guard down some more and enjoy herself. It was pretty good character development and growth for a game that wasn't a novel's worth of story.

The vast majority of the adult content scenes were fun and light, the "worst" of them perhaps being the embarrassing mishap scenes, or perhaps the few scenes where sexual activity was spontaneous and caught the character off guard, but was not actually undesired as was made clear by the reactions of the characters involved. Even these scenes were playful and lighthearted.

By "worst" I don't mean that the scenes were bad, but in comparison of their nature to the much more common non-consentual scenes in the LWR games which are as close of a game comparison as I can make, Sakura Dungeon did so much better with the adult content scenes at making them truly enjoyable and positive by contrast. You never really came away from them feeling bad or negative, and I can't say the same for some of the stuff in the LWR series, speaking personally.

The monster girl character designs were all pretty great, and the team at Winged Cloud used just about every trick in the book for dungeon crawlers like this to make the game interesting to play. Minor spoiler: [spoiler]even fake walls ugh! My "favorites" by far. At least they had the good sense to not overuse the fake walls too much like other games I have played have done. Too much of that can be very frustrating for players, but I feel like Sakura Dungeon keeps the frequency to a sane level, which is appreciated if they are going to be included in a game at all.[/spoiler]

There were a lot of secrets to uncover and I feel like in general it was a longer game than I was expecting it to be content-wise, which was a pleasant surprise. The dungeon layout designs were great and really I have a hard time thinking of any more innovations for this kind of game that could have been done as far as tricks to throw at the player to make dungeons interesting to navigate. They really did a great job with all of what they included, keeping the experience evolving as the game went along by adding new mechanics to the dungeons worked really well.

With so many characters possible to adventure with at any given point, only a few of them were really developed in depth as main or supporting characters. However, every character had points in the story where they would offer up some dialog and so it helped bring a sense of the personality of each monster girl comrade in your party by seeing how they reacted to each scene you brought them to.

Some clearly showed their preferences and inclinations towards certain persons, other monster types, activities, and even brought their specific expertise into play at times when commenting on the events taking place. It was a really nice touch I thought, giving meaning and life to characters that many other games might not have bothered telling you anything about in a similar setup.

Collecting new and progressively stronger team members from among your enemies is always an enjoyable gameplay mechanic to me in games, and here it was done quite well as a central mechanic to the game. The battle system was simple and elegant, with some nice depth to keep it interesting and engaging throughout the length of the adventure.

Overall I found this game very enjoyable, and while I don't really see it having a ton of replay value unless you're an achievement completionist, it was of a surprisingly good length, and I could see it being one of those games that's fun to go back through all over again later on after some time passes from your last trip through it too.

While I don't feel like there is much room to add additional content to this game after completing it and the after story extra bits (it felt pretty full and like things were resolved well by the end) I would love to see a sequel or something with a returning cast of characters, or maybe a prequel story about how Yomi worked her way up to dungeon lord in the first place and helped establish the town would be a great way to turn this into a game series.

And continue with the reviews. I played Dungeon Sakura over. And it is a very nice game. As the name suggests, a dungeon crawler. 😄

With typical and beautiful Sakura pictures. (Butts and Anime Tiddies.) There are several dungeons to explore. And you can unlock a lot of secrets and stuff. You should also set a lot of memory points. You never know. There are GC's/ Ecchi pictures and simple pictures. There are different outfits in the game. 😘

They can all unlock certain actions. During the adventure they fight against other girls. You train while fighting and the levels rise. They also receive various attacks, which they can teach their fighters. Sometimes stronger, sometimes more. With effects that harm the opponent. Like poison. And there is much to read again. 😄

I was more busy with exercising. But it's been fun to explore everything and listen to the music there. 😊 Only I was not able to unlock all the pictures. 😕

Here is a brief statement:

I played the game on the normal version. Later on the beta version. It did not work out as it should. Then I again tried everything to unlock. It did not work so well. Then I used the Cheat Guide at Steam. But just about all GC's unlock. After that I have reset everything. Cheat again removed. Room 22 has caused difficulties. I might eventually try again. I'm staying with the beta version of Sakura Dungeon. Sakura Dungeon is a very nice game. Something a pity that not everything has worked. But I liked it very much. Praise to Winged Cloud. 😉 😊

As I said, I tried everything, but it just did not work out. I hope it is not too bad. I've removed the cheat. I just wanted the pictures. The dungeons themselves are also beautifully designed and structured. 😉

Feeling and Characters:

Protagonists: Ceri and Yomi
Antagonist: Vesta
Surroundings/ Feeling: Medieval  👻

Sakura Dungeon is a very nice game. Have spent a lot of time with it. And it was worth it. Would highly recommend it. And there are still many games of the Winged Cloud series. 😇

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ebNQYlxZKJY

Thanks to Steam and Winged Cloud. 👍

35807775.review:
Very fun time killer. Combines old school maze rpg with killer anime characters. Not animated, but full of quality art none the less. Sound and music go well with what is on screen at any given time, and adds to atmosphere.
I played three quarters of the way through it BEFORE I found out it was origionally hentai! It is pure ecchi to start, with plenty of fan service, but upon adding the uncensor patch, umm...ya....yumminess...
The story is actually pretty good fantasy fare, with only a few "Da hell I just watch?!" moments. The 18+ content makes it more understandable, the family version stretches things a bit to make things fit together, where as it flows smoothly with the adult parts left in. 15+ version (ie; steam) just leaves ALOT more to your imagination.
I was totally enjoying it "as is" on the steam version, so you do not need the patch to enjoy this well concieved game. (The perv in me just likes it better intact, heheh) 

Pro's: Fun time waster
          Excellent character art!! (Yummy)
          Great music and sound effects that fit
          Good story, characters are "fleshed out" (sorry, heheh) and you care about them by the end.
          Decently long with plenty of optional sidequesting
          Sense of accomplishment capturing the girls to make your army

Con's: All lesbian all the time....(ok maybe not a con, heheh. But no men allowed!)
           Some gramatical errors (They do have a spot to list bugs and such though!)
           Have to find the "Real" 18+ version outside of Steam. (it makes things make more sense storywise, but not a game breaker!)
           Battles can become a bit repetative....thank you autobattle and autoskip....heheh..
           By the end You have a main group, so capturing new girls is pretty much just pokemoning.....gotta snatch'em all...
           NEEDS DLC!! MOAR CONTENT, EXPANSIONS!!!

Hope this helps, I got this from a Humble Bundle pack, but will buy sequel the second it launches if they make one!

:side note: I play offline so I've actually got over 50hrs into this, but Steam hates syncing with my Mac....

35632139.review:
The only Sakura game by winged cloud that is worth getting. Voice acting is not present, the game is still 720p in resolution.  You must opt in to the beta version to get all the fixes.

Pros:
It’s an actual game (dungeon crawler) and not purely a VN that is surprisingly quite addictive to play. You can save anytime you are not in battle which I really like. The amount of CG’s in the game far exceeds any of the Sakura VN games that I have played. The story is straightforward, easy to follow and has a proper ending.  The soundtrack used is well mastered, complements the scenes in the game and are nice to listen to.  There are cool bonus end game dungeons as well as another boss to fight after the story ends. 

Cons:
Come on why is the art still 720p in resolution? The UI scales correctly with the resolution that you set the game to but everything else is still 720p. The monsters in the game seriously look just like girls cosplaying with almost every outfit they wear being slooty and quite out of place in my opinion.  You also must opt in to the beta version of the game manually in steam to get the latest version with all the fixes. I’m not sure why they never finished patching this game. This game would have benefited tremendously from voice acting, but it doesn’t have it. 

- A disappointment baited by humble chan

스토리는 사쿠라 시리즈가 그러하듯 별볼일 없고

그래픽 적인 부분에서는 비록 19+의 선정적인 연출에 주력하긴 하지만

문제는 게임의 내용적인 분량 자체가 너무 작다는 게 문제, 던전 한 층 맵이 너무 작고

개인적으로 앞에서 괜찮다고 한 부분을 조금 더 개량하고 분량 좀 늘려서

35387632.review:
Many years ago, there was a type of game called the "dungeon crawl". They involve lots of party management, basic 4-direction movement, 2D graphics, and have a great sense of exploration. If you've played Grimrock half a decade ago, you know this sort of genre already. That said, Sakura Dungeon is one of the first good dungeon crawls I've played in years.

The party management and battle system are very reminiscent of Pokemon's triple battles, where you have three of your monsters out in the field at once, and you're required to manage the stats and moves of your active and reserve party in order to have type/elemental coverage against the wild enemies you may encounter. The art is great, and many of the dungeon floors have different aesthetics so that they each have their own "feel" to them as you progress. The game has a slight bit of grind, but for the most part you don't have to spend any time explicitly leveling up because by the time you reach the door to exit a dungeon, you'll have gotten into enough fights that you are already at a good level.

35346264.review: Finally a Sakura game that plays to Winged Cloud's strengths. Their style of random, short H-scenes doesn't make for very interesting pure visual novels, but in a dungeon crawler where all of the story is delivered in disjointed pieces, it feels right at home. The original turn-based combat system and collection-focused gameplay are pretty solid, although they suffer from the usual flaw of the genre where grinding random encounters can get tedious, and the upbeat, sex-positive tone is refreshing compared to other ero-RPGs I've seen. I don't know if I'd recommend this purely as a dungeon crawler to someone who isn't interested in using the uncensor patch and collecting lots of excellent yuri CGs, but if you are, it's certainly worth your time and money.

35089429.review:
This isn't a review, this is simply a recommendation based on first impressions.

I've had my eye on this game for quite a while.  To be honest, I've always thought the Sakura games were pretty trashy and even as joke experiences they're a bit of a slog.  Such to say, I wouldn't recommend the other games in the series, or at least Sakura Spirit.  The writing isn't particularly grand, the art's what you make of it (though I will say that the games with guest art do certainly deserve praise for their art alone), and I honestly don't know what you'd be expecting with these that you couldn't get out of other better visual novels.  Ecchi, Eroge, or otherwise.

But this one had my eye simply because it was pretty outwardly apparent that despite the series' routes, Sakura Dungeon was a game first and a visual novel second, and that despite the sexual nature of the series that, here, would be the icing on the cake rather than the main contents themselves.  The main game was about collecting enemies and using them to build a growing party as you delved into a deep-spanning dungeon.

These days, DRPGs aren't exactly uncommon.  In fact, when this was released they were probably at the height of their popularity in recent years, but with Moero Chronicle yet to be released on PC at the time, it made sense that Sakura Dungeon would take the opportunity to fill the void, striking while the iron was hot.  And it certainly came in guns blazing, because while I won't completely lavish praise over what I've experienced, the experience so far has been pretty exclusively pleasant and exceeding the low (albeit high for a Sakura title) expectations I had set for this game.

The music, which, so far, isn't particularly plentiful, is incredibly soothing when it wants to be and is easy on the ears any other time.  Quality's the name of the game here, and so far Sakura Dungeon wins that handily, to the point that despite the grindy nature of the genre I never really feel like turning down the music and putting in my own jams.

The art is...well, it's standard Sakura art.  There's no guest artist this time around so this is pretty much exactly what you'll see in most other games in the series.  Personally I think the art is just okay, it looks better than the dime a dozen random VNs that you'll see pop up but that really is about as much of a pro as I can give it.  The character designs are okay, though it doesn't really sell the provocative nature of the game too well save for by giving the characters large breasts, shiny skin, and fair amounts of unclothed areas, which is pretty bog standard.  Compare this to Huniepop, which, if budget = quality, really had no business looking better than any Sakura title, managed to (despite being a bit rough around the edges) create designs that were colorful, individual, and provocative as hell without relying simply on the fact that the girls were buxom and showed skin...well, I think you can see what I'm getting at here.

The writing's subpar but it's not nearly as bad as it could be.  Or, to put it another way, while the actual quality of the writing is particularly mediocre and lacking in any particular flair, but it seems like whoever was writing it didn't get the memo that they were making a Sakura game.  It's not trashy in any sense of the word and, surprisingly, there's a good amount of character-emphasis, in the script, even among the generic enemies-turned-recruits.  It's actually quite refreshing to see one of the monsters I captured chime in on something the main characters are discussing, even if they're quickly swept off to the side.  It makes the capture mechanic feel more substantial, and the non-story focused mobs feel more like actual people rather than simply sheep to the slaughter and pawns in an army.  That the monsters also have motives for wanting to join you makes only adds to this.

And so far that's all to be said for the game, but I think that's enough to understand my faith in this game prior to having bought it.  It's not a bad DRPG at all, and while $19.99 might be a bit much, I do certainly think that if you're looking for a good Monster Catching Dungeon Crawl on the PC, Sakura Dungeon is a pleasant surprise that will likely suit your needs.

35080863.review:
I got this game in a bundle and decided on a whim to try it.

This was my first dungeon crawler and honestly, these are probably not for me. The gameplay is pretty basic, and while I like turn based combat this one got boring pretty quick. Luckily you can speed up and automate it, which helps a bit.

The story is almost non-existent, which does not bother me much. I like the art and installed the uncensored patch but the hentai cutscenes did not really do anything for me.

The big variety of characters and monsters is alright, even if they are only good for another one or two hentai CG pictures.

My main problem is, the game is just too long. Even with sped up battles and only skimming the text, it took me ~17 hours to finish the game (some grinding included). 

The frequent crashes also do not really help. It crashed about 20-30 times over the course of my playthrough.

Overall, unless you are really into dungeon crawlers and anime / hentai games, try something else.

35040957.review:
[b]Sakura Dungeon[/b] ist ein Dungeoncrawler nach Art eines Steppers 
(man macht auf knopfdruck einzelne Schritte durch das Areal)

Fans der Reihe können aufatmen: Auch hier geht es um Damen mit respektabler Oberweite, die zu dem noch leicht bekleidet sind.

Wer keine Lust auf den Wall of Text hat, scrollt ganz runter zur Zusammenfassung

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Für einen Titel der "berüchtigten" Sakurareihe, in der es hauptsächlich um junge Damen mit respektabler Oberweite geht, hat das Spiel recht tiefgängiges Gameplay, das sogar auf dem "Normal" Level im späteren Verlauf des Spiels gewisses taktisches Know-How fordert (sofern man kein Fan stundenlanger gegnerklopperei zwecks Auflevelns der Charaktere ist) 

Wie in einem "Klicker" üblich, spielt man in der Egoperspektive und bewegt sich via Knopfdruck genau einen Schritt vorwärts (mehrere, wenn man die Taste gedrückt hält, es ist aber keine flüssige Laufbewegung), rückwärts, zur Seite  oder dreht sich nach links oder rechts. 

Gegner erscheinen via Randomencounter, das bedeutet, man sieht sie nicht, bis der Kampf beginnt und sie erscheinen zufällig beim herumlaufen im Dungeon, sowie in zufälliger Formation von bis zu drei Stück auf ein Mal. 

Im Kampf entscheidend  sind hier, anders wie in RPGs üblich, nicht unbedingt die Statuswerte der Kombatanten (wobei diese auch wichtig sind) sondern eher der Level, denn Gegner, die einen höheren level als die Gruppe haben, erlangen Boni im Kampf, die den Kampfablauf teils enorm beeinflussen können. Statuswerte wie Stärke oder Vitalität hingegen, bringen kleinere Boni, haben allerdings mehrere Aufgaben. So erhöht stärke nicht nur den Schaden, den man mittels physischer Angriffe anrichtet, sondern verringert auch den erlittenen Schaden durch solche.

Ebenfalls wichtig sind diverse Ressourcen im Kampf, die sich zwar nach und nach erholen, aber bei unachtsamen gebrauch schnell zur Neige gehen. 
VP-Vitalitätspunkte. Wenn sie bei null sind, ist der Charakter Kampfunfähig
AP-Abilitypunkte. Haben unterschiedliche Verwendungsmöglichkeiten. Fast jeder Skill im Spiel verbraucht welche und je mehr man davon hat, desto eher ist man in der Lage, feindliche Angriffe zu blocken oder ihnen auszuweichen
CP-Konzentrationspunkte (oder Concentrationpoints) Sie werden für manche Techniken benötigt und schützen einen Charakter vor zuständen, die seine Treffer- und Ausweichquote beinträchtigen. Wenn der Wert 10 erreicht, gelangt man in einen Zustand, in dem das genaue Gegenteil der Fall ist. Die Treffer und Auswechquote werden erhöht.

Sollte man es schaffen, einem Gegner die Kleidung zu beschädigen, erleidet dieser Abzüge in seiner Regeneration
(Das ist also nicht nur ein grafisches Feature) 

Ein in der Vorstellung bereits erwähntes Feature ist die Möglichkeit, gefallene Gegner zu fangen. Das ist nicht sehr präzise ausgedrückt, denn damit ein Gegner gefangen werden kann, muss man einen speziellen Skill auf ihn anwenden und ihn damit auch besiegen. Zudem darf der Gegner im Level nicht höher sein, als der Anwender des Skills und von jeder Monsterspezies kann man nur ein einziges Exemplar besitzen.

Eine Sache, die mir erst als Gameplaypatzer ins Auge gefallen ist, ist der Umstand, dass niemand, außer der Ritterin, die man von Beginn an steuert, durch Level-Ups wirklich stärker wird bzw sich deren Statuswerte nicht erhöhen. In einigen Reviews wird das als schlecht dargestellt, macht aber in Anbetracht der Menge an möglichen begleitern, die man haben kann, dem Umstand, dass Statuswerte nicht alles sind und der Tatsache, dass man recht bald zugang zu Attributseigernden Items hat (die Begrenzungen unterliegen, weshalb man nicht alles in die Protagonisten stecken kann)
garnicht mal so abwegig ist.

[h1]Grafik, Soundtrack[/h1]
Die Grafik ist recht gut und in HD. Die Artworks der Gegner und Cutscenes sind hochwertig.
Der Soundtrack ist gut, kein zeitloses Meisterwerk, aber gut.

[h1]Zusammenfassung[/h1]
[b]Pro[/b]
[list]
    [*]großer Dungeon mit vielen Features wie Falltüren, Geheimgängen und seichter Rätselkost
    [*]Vielzahl an Gegnern, von denen die meisten fangbar sind
    [*]taktisch relativ tiefgängies aber eingängiges Kampfsystem
    [*]Viele gezeichnete Cutscenes auch ohne den Uncensoing-Patch (mit Patch sind es natürlich mehr)
    [*]Ingamegallerie mit Cutscenes und Charaktersprites
[/list]

[b]Kontra[/b]
[list]
    [*]teils fragwürdige Zensur (Viele Cutscenes sind nur mit Patch sichtbar und einige davon sind nicht expliziter als die, die ohne Patch sichtbar sind)
    [*]Hauptcharaktere extrem overpowered im Vergleich zum Rest
[/list]

[b]Fazit[/b]
Sakura Dungeon ist, von der Seite betrachtet, ein normaler Dungeoncrawler, wo sämtliche handelnde Personen junge Frauen sind (mit respektabler Oberweite). Fans von kurzweiligen Dungeoncrawlern und Fanservice durch leicht bekleidete Damen können beherzt zugreifen. Wer kein wirklicher Fan von diesen Dingen ist, wird am Spiel wohl auch keinen Spaß haben. Ich habe gewusst, was auf mich zu kommt und wurde sogar positiv überrascht (auf gameplayebene) daher von mir eine Kaufempfehlung.

And sure, it adds plenty of lewd scenes and images with the cute girls and cute monsters). But the gameplay goes far beyond its cute anime sexualized facade.

It's enjoyable and fun, and it lasts quite a bit, more than one expects of most games, nowadays. 35024514.review:
This game actually isn't all that bad. Yeah, I get it, Winged Cloud's 'reputation' and all that, but even going into *that*, some of their other games aren't even really terrible(Fantasy was alright but the writer left the team IIRC, and Spirit had some kind of genuine quality put into it). I consider this some-what akin to the latest dungeon crawler I have played(Wizardry 8, more similar to the previous games that weren't free-roam and were more step-by-step gameplay). Another game that I believe is a lot more obscure that this is clearly inspired by is DMC(Demon Master Chris).

I feel like I should touch on Gameplay first since that will surprise anyone straight off. Yes, this game has gameplay. It's a pretty decent dungeon crawler and, as another review stated, it's "wizardry, with a modern touch of weeb". Weeb jokes aside, it's very wizardy-like(as I consider wizardry a classic dungeon crawler series). The combat is simple turn-based. You use AP for abilities and HP for health. Under 50% HP, criticals remove what little your characters have on as clothing, because yes this has to be mentioned. This reduces your HP regen outside of combat and I believe inside of combat as well. Outside of combat, the gameplay is more or less your standard dungeon crawler exploring. One notable thing that bothered me was that lots of the destructable containers didn't really have anything in them, so some exploring felt pointless but I always like to fully fill out my maps anyways. Aside from that, the gameplay was very well done and near the end it actually started getting pretty fun.

The story is kind of a standard "clear out the dungeon and defeat its dungeon lord" fantasy story, except you find out immedietally that you play as the previous dungeon lord and someone else has taken your place over the last few hundred years you've been asleep. You are attacked by a knight adventurer, you defeat her, and then you put her under a contract of sorts to enlist her help. So thus' begins the adventure. I wouldn't say there's anything special about it but I also won't say it's bad. There's a few grammar issues, but it's mostly in misplaced words here and there. I will say that it was enjoyable to listen to every character's responses to each situation, as every character in your current party tends to say something at event locations.

Soundtrack usually works alongside every Sakura game in a decent way. Soundtrack was pretty good in this game but nothing particularly special. 

Now, obviously there's the "winged cloud makes porn games" 'meme' and that's depending on how you look at it. With the 18+ patch, it adds in certain scenes you wouldn't see otherwise that are very descriptive, and the non-adult specific scenes have under-18 version to them. At the most, they are very implied in the under-18 versions. That being said, they're good at what they do and I would be lying if I were to say it specifically ruins the game. What I would say is that if you don't want to see it then you could just not get the patch and suffer through the ecchi scenes but you have to consider that it's still a Sakura game, it's going to be there. Usually it's amusing at the very least.

I mean come on, this is winged cloud's "first game" as far as I know, and it's pretty good. I got 20 genuine hours out of it and I got it from the Humble Bundle for as cheap as... $11? Pretty good, and I'd say it was worth it. Possibly not worth $21 but definitely worth $10. They could definitely get away with making more games like these, maybe even expanding off of this game and making it better. What makes this game better is that all of their previous games were visual novels that everyone just sort of made fun of, and then they released this game and it's a full-fledged game that's actually *really* good. If you like dungeon crawlers and you know what to expect from a Sakura game, then go ahead and get this. It's pretty fun.

34845282.review:
Sakura games usually are visual novels. Read a bunch of text, click to make a few decisions, watch beautiful artwork. This game is a real GAME! It is a mechanically easy dungeon crawler á la Legend of Grimrock or Eye of the beholder. Although nowhere near the complexity of those two, it has a nice skill and resistances system, varies enemy types more than some big titles, throws far too many companions to chose from at you, and needs quite a lot of grinding in between, which could have been avoided. All in all an enjoyable game, interesting and emotional story, and has different difficulties. If you like the screenshots with a bit of not to hard dungeon crawling, you can't go wrong. Patch is available, as are console commands, if you get stuck or want to skip grinding.

MORE please, altough the price (20€) is a bit high for nowadays.

34830083.review:
Disclaimer: Strongly Recommended only for those who are of legal age to view mature countent.

So far I've put a good amount of time to see where this game is going and it feels pretty straightforward and decent for a dungeon crawler. There isn't any tedious tasks to get certain items or crafting as you either give the items to the npcs in town or buy a limited set of items from the store so it's refreshing but, feels very simplified. The capturing system is pretty unique and in a way reminds me of SMT: Strange Journey which is vital to keeping a strong party in the game. The story isn't all that great because the characters don't seem to have too much depth and background but, they're fun to an extent since most seem to have pretty redundent lines affixed to their personalities. There is also a patch for those who are interested in seeing more explicit content.

To sum it up it's more of a harem collecting ecchi VN with dungeon crawler mechanics.
If you're into what I just described, I'd recommend it, If not, just give it a hard pass. (We all know this is for the lewd content anyways) 
In my opinion it's neither great or bad. If you're looking for a good dungeon crawler there should be better at around the same price.  I also don't think it's worth the 20$ asking price but if you're thinking of buying, definitely do it when it's on sale or in a bundle.

34829541.review:
Okay, hear me out here. This game is actually pretty good, despite what it may seem at first glance.

Sakura Dungeon is a game that can basically be described by "Wizardry but with a modern weeb touch". In other words, it's a first-person dungeon crawling game with VN elements, RPG elements, and a lot of anime tiddies. If you've played other games developed by Winged Cloud, this is similar to those, but with a heavy emphasis on the RPG gameplay.

The game is actually quite good. The main character is an large-chested ex-dungeon master who awakens from a long slumber by a rowdy adventurer with... similar-sized assets. She then finds out that she had been sealed away, and in the meantime, her dungeon was taken over by an usurper. She then decides to retake her dungeon with the help of her newfound friend. Along the way, you befriend "monsters" in the dungeon to assist you on your quest, a la Pokemon. To be honest, the story isn't anything super amazing, but it'll keep you entertained. The best part of this game is the art and gameplay.

The art doesn't need to be mentioned about all that much. Just your standard, colorful Winged Cloud ecchi drawings. Most, if not all of them, contain ideal camera angles of anime girls in very suggestive positions whilst wearing little to no clothing. This time, there are plentiful CGs to unlock (two for each monster, and then some), so every time one is unlocked, it's always a treat. I, like many others, recommend you download the R18 patch, which can be found on WC's Patreon.

Unlike other Sakura games, gameplay in Sakura Dungeon is reminiscent of first-person dungeon crawlers, such as Wizardry, Etrian Odyssey, old-school Shin Megami Tensei, etc. You move around the dungeon with WASDQE or the on-screen directional pad, and during battle you can use a mouse for selections. The combat system is a little hard to grasp at first, but you'll get used to it in no time. For a quick summary and explanation, see below (you can skip to the next section if you don't care):

-All units have VP and AP (in other games, they would be HP and MP, respectively). Units also have CP as well (more info down below). VP and AP regenerate per turn.
-AP is consumed when you do any sort of action outside of Guard, or when you get hit.
-The lower your AP is, the easier it is for enemies to hit you. Therefore, it's better to use less-accurate, more-powerful attacks when the difference between your AP and the enemy's AP is significant. Use more-accurate, less-powerful attacks when their AP is high.
-The more damage you take, the more your clothes will rip, until there is almost nothing left (the tiddies and the parts "down there" are revealed in all their glory [b]IF[/b] you have the uncensor patch, but nothing really sexually explicit). Your automatic VP and AP regeneration is slowed down, among various other nerfs. You will need to return home and pay a fee to fix your clothing.
-When you land an attack, your CP increases by 1. When your CP reaches 10, you essentially become invincible and can spam your low-accurate moves to your heart's content. Conversely, if your CP reaches 0, you're pretty much helpless and should switch out to the backrow.

I [url=https://steamcommunity.com/app/407330/discussions/0/358415738179023426/][b][u]HIGHLY RECOMMEND[/u][/b][/url] downloading the excellent 'Abyssal Makeover' and 'Additional Dialogue' mods for this game by shadowwolftjc, in addition to the Uncensor patch by Winged Cloud. Shadow's mods really do overhaul many of the games flaws that other reviewers have touched on, and makes the overall experience much more enjoyable. You can find his mods in the Discussions page. Thanks, Shadow!

Overall, Sakura Dungeon is a really fun game. If you're interested in old-school first-person dungeon crawlers or just really like anime tiddies (or both, like me), I definitely recommend this game. And don't forget the mods I mentioned! They really do make the game at least twice as enjoyable.

33707850.review:
As of this review, I have completed the main story on the hard difficulty setting (don't mind the lack of achievements saying so, the restoration patch seems to screw up some of the achievements).

Sakura dungeon is a grindy, build-your-own team dungeon crawler. It doubles as an h-game, so don't expect an amazing/emotionally moving story. However, you can at least expect something to keep you tied to the game until the very end.

In regards to the gameplay; there are alot of things this game did right. For one, the challenge of assembling a formidable team at the beginning of the game was one of the most enjoyable parts of this whole experience. Until you obtain (or level up) some powerful characters you get later on in the game, choosing which monsters to bring into the dungeon was a unique experience. Each character has their own set of active and passive skills; and unless you're really lucky, those skill scrolls that you find in chest only come once in a while so you better make them count!

There is a fine balance between the three 'types' of attacks: melee, ranged, and magic. Although I did not find myself using ranged characters often, I found that fine tuning my team to fight off all types of enemies as I progressed through the dungeon was very enjoyable. You may find that one skill is unarguably straight-up better than another, but that character may have better stats/other skills that fit with your team. Overall, the team-building and combat system is balanced and I enjoyed it thoroughly.

My greatest gripe with this game is that it's as grindy (perhaps a bit less) than other dungeon crawlers I have played. At least for the hard difficulty setting, it's fine to fight the floor boss while being underleveled; Afterall, it's 6 against 1. As a sexy feminized version of Ash Ketchum, I want to collect all the monsters in the game so I can build the best team possible. It forces the player to use Ceri (or another character later) to be the same level of what you want to capture. This means that the game pretty much forces to use Ceri/whoever with capture always on your main team to soak up all the XP. At least Ceri eventually becomes one of the strongest characters in the game, but you may not use another character with the capture skill on your main team always. The game could've mitigated this by increasing the XP or having a fair-share of XP among all monsters in your party (The master skill, the one that does exactly this, is only for one character and it's still a tiny amount!)

Overall, this is a great dungeon crawler to sink 30+ hours into. As a plus, most of the characters are pretty charming and they made the character development of a few characters actually legit. I don't plan on playing through the other sakura games as I enjoy my eroges with either real gameplay or an interesting story, but I can highly recommend this game if you don't mind the once-in-a-while tireless grinding.

Grinding still not as bad as some games though. Choke on my chewed flavorless gum Disagaea.

[FR]
Sakura Dungeon est un jeu "RPG" et "Visual Novel" où il faudra savoir parler anglais pour vraiment l'apprécier. 

La série Sakura est en principe des "Visual Novel", le point fort du jeu sera donc évidemment de ce côté. 
L'écriture est sympa et on prend beaucoup de plaisir à lire sur ce jeu, l'histoire reste correcte avec un petit côté d'amitié à la "Shonen" et beaucoup de comique et des barres de rire avec des répétitions de blagues qui ne sont au contraire pas du tout ennuyantes. 

On aura à peu près 3 types de personages;
Les personnages principaux se développent de plus en plus au fil du temps, il faudra faire les évenements en plus de la trame principale pour en savoir d'avantage. 
Les personnages secondaires sont eux aussi attachants, ils interviennents à certains moment du jeu lors de petits dialogues sympathiques. 
Les autres personnages capturables sont là plus pour le fun mais sont éphémères et n'interviennent plus forcément en avançant dans le jeu. 
Le tout est quand même travailler et on les apprécie globalement tous. 

Je recommande donc ce jeu pour son histoire et son comique qui mettent la bonne humeur et valent le coup !

Concernant le côté RPG;
La difficulté est là au début du jeu, mais elle s'évapore petit à petit même en mode Abyssal qui est la difficulté maximum.
Dès que l'on comprend quelques mécaniques tout est plus simple, il suffit de farm plus ou moins selon la difficulté.
[spoiler] L'histoire influence l'évolution des personnages ce qui nous donne des stats quelques peu abusés au bout d'un moment mais cela reste logique.[/spoiler]  

Les contres du jeu sont sur le côté RPG, les donjons ne sont pas très amusants même si ils sont variés, on peut s'ennuyer durant les phases d'explorations qui sont quand même une bonne partie du jeu. 
Les personnages ne sont pas du tout égaux, il y en a des bien plus fort que d'autres, le fossé est réel même si cela reste logique, on aura plus tendance à jouer les plus forts que ceux qu'on souhaite vraiment. 
Enfin les attaques et les stats sont complétements foirés, ils manquent des indications qu'on aurait bien voulu savoir. 
On peut très bien jouer Ceri en mage et ça marche très bien. (J'ai fait le jeu en Abyssal en Solo Ceri mage)

Le jeu n'est pas un vrai bon rpg, on peut l'apprécier mais il reste bourrin, répétitif et mal organisé, on va plutôt spam certaines attaques en boucles jusqu'à ce que l'ennemi meurt.
La musique est énormément répétitive elle aussi lors des donjons/combats prend la tête au bout d'un moment, mais elle reste en accord avec l'ambiance. 
Le support manettes n'est pas très agréable, je recommande de jouer à la souris car plus rapide et plus facile. 
De plus il y a quelques problèmes au niveau des clics et de l'affichage, il ne faudra pas être trop rapide sinon le jeu ne va pas lui faire ce qu'on aurait voulu, et lors des achats d'items en masse, la souris bouge d'un pixel vers le haut et se décalle donc et change d'item. 

Conclusion : Si vous aimez lire et les situations cocasses, prenez-le sans hésiter, si vous êtes là pour le RPG et les donjons, vous allez être déçu mais les intéractions fréquentes entre les personnages seront là pour vous donner envie de continuer !
Sakura Dungeon reste un jeu qui vaut le détour et qui mérite qu'on s'y accroche. 

A savoir que le jeu possède quelques problèmes avec des succès où il faudra mettre le jeu en mode Beta pour les recevoir.

Sakura Dungeon is an RPG where you use cute gay under-dressed anime girls to fight other cute gay under-dressed anime girls, clothes being shredded in the process. You should know if this is your type of game from this premise alone, but I'll try to help if you're undecided.

Is this game worth $19.99? Probably not. Animation is essentially non-existent, with only a few unimpressive effects for attacks, and dungeon crawling being a first person affair reminiscent of 80's RPGs. There's no voice acting work whatsoever either. However the character art is all solid, the background art that isn't the lame dungeon design looks generally gorgeous, and while the soundtrack isn't the most expansive I enjoyed all of the tracks, music ranging from relaxing to whimsical to being legitimately ominous. And of course there are many, many lewd CGs you'll come across that are pretty sexy. Still I'd try to wait for this game being on sale before picking it up.

The RPG combat itself is uninvolved, a turn-based menu selection affair with a focus on action point management. Only a handful of moves offer anything besides "deal w damage to x targets using y type of damage at z chance to hit." It's not the most exciting thing in the world, but it's functional, and that was good enough for me. Critical hits will sometimes cause characters clothes to be damaged, revealing even more skin (which is the only sign of injury people sustain in this setting, amusingly enough), but it's not very relevant on a gameplay level. It doesn't require ludicrous amounts of grinding to level your characters decently, since exploring dungeon floors thoroughly will level your characters enough all on its own. The dungeon crawling itself is bare bones but passable as well, with each floor usually having some kind of gimmick to keep you interested, ranging from invisible walls to finding keys to pitfalls, standard fare.

However the most disappointing aspect of the game is the 'capture' mechanic, which is billed as one of the most important features. It's very Pokemon-esque, where you're trying to lower opponent's health totals before capturing them (by the way I'm really glad this is an all-female game because a dude capturing random women would make me feel more uncomfortable, no matter how polite he was). But unlike in Pokemon you can't really pick favorite 'monsters' to optimize and level up. The unique characters you recruit over the game are flat out better than the capturable monsters, and unlike a typical RPG you can't change the movesets or abilities of your monsters to a significant degree, only being able to use  scrolls, very limited one-shot items that are the equivalent of TMs from Pokemon, to teach generic moves that aren't much better than what your monster starts with. You can also improve stats using seeds, but they're also hard to come by, and ludicrously expensive to buy from the item store, so you'll end up only significantly boosting the stats of a few characters. 

This sucks because there are many, many cute monster girls, something like over 50 of them, that you'll run into while dungeon crawling. They have cute, boobtastic designs and they'll have amusing unique quips to say whenever they're part of your dungeon-delving party. But it's extremely hard to justify keeping them in your party for more than a few floors, since they'll become obsolete way too damn quickly. Leveling any character in your party will not improve their base states or naturally let them gain new moves, while new monster your see deeper in the dungeon will have higher base stats and somewhat better moves, and the unique characters you pick up will have the best stats and moves of all. And bizarrely there's no achievement for collecting monsters, so there's no incentive at all to "catch 'em all."

But despite the mediocre gameplay and the failure of the capture mechanic, what makes me able to recommend the game is the lewdness (of course), the characters, and the writing, surprisingly enough. It's aware of its trappings as a generic fantasy setting and goes to minor lengths to explain the functioning of the setting, explaining why the main character had a dungeon in the first place, where magic comes from, how teleporters work, a little of the mythology of the setting, just minor lines here and there that do a lot to help sell the game as believable to me (even if they never, ever say why everyone is a semi-naked anime girl). Plus, despite the capture theme of the game it does a good job of avoiding feeling too rapey, always feeling bubbly and upbeat during its many kinky moments. The story itself is not very interesting, but I don't feel like that's all that important. Decent characterization is far more valuable in a game like this.

The main character, an ancient fox spirit named Yomi, is a pleasant, seductive, yet protective individual. She lives in a setting where literally every character and monster is a sexy, lewd girl, with almost all of them being friendly, and her characterization makes perfect sense considering that fact. True, she spends the whole game banging anyone who's eager and willing, but she also always tries to convince monsters to help her cause,  and is always fiercely protective of her underlings, to the point where it's almost her catchphrase. She says she loves every one of her subjects, and I can believe it. So basically if you have a MILF fetish you'll love her.

The other main character is named Ceri, an adventuring knight who is Yomi's first recruit. She's Yomi's plaything in the course of the game, being subject to relentless teasing and being compelled to wear ridiculous costumes like bikinis and lingerie into battle. But what's interesting about her is that she's a human, a middling adventurer who as the game progresses becomes more and more powerful and starts questioning what a person should do when they're capable of  eventually defeating gods. I was not expecting a porn game to ask what it means to be human, and while this game isn't very philosophical, the fact that it's brought up at all is impressive. Plus her and Yomi's growing relationship in the course of the game is honestly adorable to see.

Overall I can recommend Sakura Dungeon. The gameplay sucks a bit, but if you don't mind that in favor of lewd girls doing lewd things then snag this game. Absolutely download the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/407330/discussions/0/357287935546522803/]uncensor patch[/url]. If you're playing a lewd game and missing out on lewd, what's the point? Also think about checking out the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/407330/discussions/0/358415738179023426/]Abyssal Makeover Mod[/url]. I've never played it, but it looks like it fixes a lot of my core complaints about the game, and I suspect I would have had a much better time playing through it if I had it installed.

31941932.review:
Я не питаю особой любви к играм серии "Sakura", их составляющими, обычно, являются - непримечательная музыка, геймплей из чистого скипанья диалогов и продолжительность вроде "А-ха-ха я включил skip и прошел игру за 2 минуты". В этой игре гринда действительно многовато, как видите я наиграл 80 часов, [spoiler] На самом деле игру можно спокойно, полностью пройти за 40-50 часов, но я отходил во время долгих сеансов за чайком, слоупочил и т.д. [/spoiler]  но из-за некоторых моментов я об этом не жалею. 
[h1] Непосредственно о геймплее [/h1]
Наш ГГ - это дух-лисица из китайской мифологии, которая просыпается непонятно где и дальше, ей предстоит разобраться, что да как и решить все проблемы. 
Сам же процесс игры таков, мы проходим по системе уровней, [spoiler] их в игре где-то 30 или где-то так [/spoiler] на каждом уровне есть несколько типов противников, старые и новые. Обычно, противник появляющийся на уровне впервые, и являющийся чуть сильнее рядовых противников, будет на следующем в качестве рядового. Противники же наши - милые девочки-животные, если у вас обычная тян, то Вы можете поймать ее [spoiler] ПОКЕБОЛОМ [/spoiler] перком под названием "Magic capture" или магический захват [strike] экрана [/strike]. Ну, а если Вам хочется захамутать босса, придется поднапрячься. Вам придется выполнить задание, типа: "Принеси мне предмет, который валяется через шесть этажей за невидимой стеной...". 
И вот тут есть загвоздка, [spoiler] ТIКАЙ З МIСТУ ЭТА IГРА ПРО ГРIНД1 [/spoiler] в игре 30 этажей, на каждом новые противники, но самих биома только четыре! ЧЕТЫРЕ, КАРЛ! Первый биом - классическое подземелье, меня успел закалупать, ибо его было много и музыка боя в нем мне категорически не нравилась. Второй - в восточном стиле, с раздвижными дверями и т.д., мне понравился, я в нем отдохнул и музыка боя там была шикарная. Третий - коридоры из пещанника, мне "выжег глаза", ибо он большой, а камни одинаковые и яркие. И четвертый - бездна, этот биом не особо большой и в нем более-менее интересно.
Бой происходит в игре примерно так: у Вас есть шкала по инициативе, панель из шести произвольных перков, выбранных Вами и спрайты участников битвы, над которыми изображены их ХП и выносливость. Каждая использованная способность отнимает выносливоть, а та по которой проходит удар не только теряет ХП, но и выносливость. Здесь и система критических ударов... [spoiler] которая сбивает нетолько ХП, но и одежду... Вместе с "расширяющим" патчем это - единственный способ увидеть прелести некоторых персонажей...Привет Сильви. [/spoiler]
[h1] Музыка, CG и Сюжет [/h1] 
Музыка в этой игре меня приятно удивила. В отличие от других сакур, тут саундтрек где-то на час и написан он получше, чем в пердыдущих. Лично мой любимый трек - это "I need more clothes". [spoiler] Да, они все называются примерно так. [/spoiler]
Кому надо, вот ссылка на плейлист с саундтреком: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL28_eRFIuaoIHNa1avL6Oky-E3IXkwFtY 
С артом в игре тоже все в порядке, а галлерея с "расширяющим" патчем в несколько раз больше, чем в других сакурах. Да и сам арт выполнен качественно.
Вот вам ссылка на патч: https://denpasoft.com/patch0x.rpa
Сюжет здесь гораздо лучше, чем в других сакурах, но он растянут из-за большой части гринда в игре... Концовка в игре неплохая, по началу я думал, что она будет довольно сильной, но все же ее подслили. 
[h1] Итог [/h1]
Я бы рекомендовал эту игру, тем, у кого много времени на игры, так как тут много слегка муторного геймплея, кому нравится эроге, и тем, кому нравились прошлые сакуры. [spoiler] И это...Закрывайте дверь, когда играете в эту игру... [/spoiler]
